Buying $ XRP isn’t the same thing as buying shares in Ripple, the company. Shares of Ripple are not available for purchase. I’m not sure what you are saying.

Well, XRP is a digital asset that Ripple holds. It’s not necessarily connected to Ripple (the company) anymore than any other asset Ripple holds. But 1,000,000 do make what is called a “ripple.” My kids used to call them ripples, but I haven’t heard anyone else do it in years.
It really bothers me that people buy XRP thinking they are purchasing shares of Ripple. It really should be made clear what XRP is and what it isn’t.
I don’t call it Ripple.
Hmm. I guess they did write ripple in the lower case, but it’s reckless to call it that, IMO. Too many people think they are purchasing shares of the company.
